page.title: 02COLDEAST VILLAGE.
page.content: {Coldeast village}is about 175 years old with approximately 200 houses and a predominantly old population.A post office/store,public house(The Star), owned by Pete Budd a singer from The Wurzels folk group,and a United Reformed Church serve the village.This former chapel holds 100 people but wedding and funeral services do not take place.The various leisure activites take place at Liverton Village Hall and include bingo, whist drives, brownies, guides, folk dancing W.I. over 60's and Sunday School meetings. Housing is supplememted by 2 residential caravan sites (70) and one campsite. Plans are afoot to double the village size. In 1977 the main A38 dual carriageway opened and {Coldeast}breathed a sigh of relief. Residents now fear traffic may rise as Trago Mills seek access via {Coldeast.
